value.title: Custom Functions Made Easy in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a lot about Power Query M scripting language, and how to create custom functions with that. With recent updates of Power BI Desktop, creating custom functions made easier and easier every month. This started with bringing Parameters a few months ago and adding source query for the function

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Date dimension or calendar table is one of the most important dimensions in any BI system. In this video, I'm showing you how easy is to create a date dimension using Power Query. The script of this video can be found in my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/create-a-date-dimension-in-power-bi-in-4-steps-step-1-calendar-columns

value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it wonâ€™t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.

value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.title: Sentiment Colors for Gauge Visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gauge Visual is a great visual for KPIs, however, the Gauge visual in Power BI doesnâ€™t have the sentiment colors as an option. Sentiment colors make a gauge much more understandable, you can easily find out is the value high, low, or in the mid-range. Fortunately, there is conditional formatting that

value.title: How to build a simple dashboard
value.excerpt: How to build a simple dashboard

value.title: Create a data-driven story with Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Power BI helps you create vibrant, highly useful reports that form a cohesive, data-driven story. Youâ€™ll learn how to use buttons, bookmarks, and other navigation techniques. Additionally, youâ€™ll learn how to integrate Power BI reports with other applications. Power BI visuals can interact with each other, letting the user see exactly which data is appealing to them. Youâ€™ll also explore Power BI report themes to create a unified reporting experience across all reports.

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Create a Power BI Dashboard in 10 Minutes!
value.excerpt: Enjoy my free full course on Udemy https://www.udemy.com/share/102Qqu/ Learn how to quickly create your first dashboard using Microsoft Power BI fast. This tutorial will teach you how to load, transform and visualize data with ease.  Contact me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland
